member.summary:
Your blockchain node administror's public key.
ChainAdminAddress is required for the CLI client to function as expected;

member.name: P:MCWrapper.CLI.Options.CliOptions.ChainBurnAddress
member.summary:
Blockchain address used for 'burning' Assets/Streams. This is not a required property, however, it is nice to have the value available at the code level in case assets/streams do need to be burned.
ChainBurnAddress is not required for the CLI client to function as expected;

member.name: P:MCWrapper.CLI.Options.CliOptions.ChainBinaryLocation
member.summary:
Local directory the application may locate the Multichain library files (multichaind.exe, multichain-util.exe, and multichain-cli.exe, etc..)
ChainBinaryLocation is required for the CLI and Forge clients to function as expected;

member.name: P:MCWrapper.CLI.Options.CliOptions.ChainDefaultLocation
member.summary:
Default directory that blockchains are found
ChainDefaultLocation is required for the CLI client to function as expected;
Generally, this location in Windows is %AppData%\MultiChain, the full path is C:\Users\{Current User}\AppData\Roaming\MultiChain
Generally, this location in Linux is ~/.multichain

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Extensions.MultiChainCoreCliServices.AddMultiChainCoreCliServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary:
**** Please be aware! MCWrapper.CLI has only been tested and configured to function in a Windows environment. ****
**** We are working on a Linux client for version 2.0.0, current version is 1.0.0 ****
Use this method to add MultiChain Command Line Interface (CLI) services to an application's service container.
Be aware a MultiChain blockchain network must be installed and configured externally from this application. However, consumers using the MCWrapper.CLI ForgeClient are able to create, start, and stop Hot and Cold node wallet types directly from an application.
The MultiChain library and installation instructions are availabale at https://multichain.com for consumers not using the MCWrapper.CLI ForgeClient
This method automatically loads the CliOptions and RuntimeParamOptions from the local environment's variable store. CliOptions and RuntimeParamOptions are implemented in such a way that during instantiation the local environment's variable store is automatically parsed for available parameter values. In our opinion this is the best and most secure method to implement MCWrapper within an application. Set each environment's variables and let MCWrapper lazy load all the values. Easy peasy!
member.param: Service container

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Extensions.MultiChainCoreCliServices.AddMultiChainCoreCliServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary:
**** Please be aware! MCWrapper.CLI has only been tested and configured to function in a Windows environment. ****
**** We are working on a Linux client for version 2.0.0, current version is 1.0.0 ****
Use this method to add MultiChain Command Line Interface (CLI) services to an application's service container.
Be aware a MultiChain blockchain network must be installed and configured externally from this application. However, consumers using the MCWrapper.CLI ForgeClient are able to create, start, and stop Hot and Cold node wallet types directly from an application.
The MultiChain library and installation instructions are availabale at https://multichain.com for consumers not using the MCWrapper.CLI ForgeClient
This method automatically loads the CliOptions and RuntimeParamOptions from the IConfiguration interface (appsettings.json file usually). Mildly secure method, our second preference if environment variables are not an option.
member.param: Service container
Configuration pipeline

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Extensions.MultiChainCoreCliServices.AddMultiChainCoreCliServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{MCWrapper.CLI.Options.CliOptions},System.Action{MCWrapper.Ledger.Entities.Options.RuntimeParamOptions})
member.summary:
**** Please be aware! MCWrapper.CLI has only been tested and configured to function in a Windows environment. ****
**** We are working on a Linux client for version 2.0.0, current version is 1.0.0 ****
Use this method to add MultiChain Command Line Interface (CLI) services to an application's service container.
Be aware a MultiChain blockchain network must be installed and configured externally from this application. However, consumers using the MCWrapper.CLI ForgeClient are able to create, start, and stop Hot and Cold node wallet types directly from an application.
The MultiChain library and installation instructions are availabale at https://multichain.com for consumers not using the MCWrapper.CLI ForgeClient
This method requires the CliOptions and RuntimeParamOptions property values to be explicitly passed via the and Action parameters when added to the DI pipeline. Least secure method and should only be used during testing or in sandbox environments.
member.param: Service container
Blockchain profile configuration (Information the app will use to connect to a MultiChain ledger)
Runtime parameter configuration (How a MultiChain ledger should behave)

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Helpers.MultiChainPathHelper.GetHotWalletParamsDatPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Get the local file path where a specific MultiChain blockchain hot node params.dat file resides.
If no is passed then the following default locations are used.
Windows - C:\Users\{CurrentUser}\AppData\Roaming\MultiChain\{}\params.dat
Linux - ./multichain/{}/params.dat
MacOS - ./multichain/{}/params.dat
member.param: Optionally consumers may override the default directory detected by MCWrapper.CLI with their own file path value.
Name of the target blockchain.

Get the local file path where a specific MultiChain blockchain cold node params.dat file resides.
If no is passed then the following default locations are used.
Windows - C:\Users\{CurrentUser}\AppData\Roaming\MultiChainCold\{}\params.dat
Linux - ./multichain-cold/{}/params.dat
MacOS - ./multichain-cold/{}/params.dat
member.param: Optionally consumers may override the default directory detected by MCWrapper.CLI with their own file path value.
Name of the target blockchain.

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Helpers.MultiChainPathHelper.GetMultiChainDExePath(System.String)
member.summary:
Verify and return a valid filepath to access multichaind.exe. 'DirectoryNotFoundException' returned on file not found.
1. If the consumer has passed a 'multichainExeDirectory' the location is verified and returned.
2. If the consumer did not pass a 'multichainExeDirectory' value or 'multichainExeDirectory' doesn't exist then we attempt to detect the current Operating System.
- If Windows is detected then we determine if either of the default locations exist 'C:\multichaind.exe' or 'C:\multichain\multichaind.exe.
- If Linux is detected then we determine if the default location exists '/user/bin/local/multichaind'.
3. If none of the verified paths a valid then a 'DirectoryNotFoundException' is thrown.
member.param: Optionally consumers may override the default directory detected by MCWrapper.CLI with their own file path value.

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Helpers.MultiChainPathHelper.GetMultiChainCliExePath(System.String)
member.summary:
Verify and return a valid filepath to access multichain-cli.exe. 'DirectoryNotFoundException' returned on file not found.
1. If the consumer has passed a 'multichainExeDirectory' the location is verified and returned.
2. If the consumer did not pass a 'multichainExeDirectory' value or 'multichainExeDirectory' doesn't exist then we attempt to detect the current Operating System.
- If Windows is detected then we determine if either of the default locations exist 'C:\multichain-cli.exe' or 'C:\multichain\multichain-cli.exe.
- If Linux is detected then we determine if the default location exists '/user/bin/local/multichain-cli'.
3. If none of the verified paths a valid then a 'DirectoryNotFoundException' is thrown.
member.param: Optionally consumers may override the default directory detected by MCWrapper.CLI with their own file path value.

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliMiningClient.PrioritiseTransactionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double)

summary.para: Accepts the transaction into mined blocks at a higher (or lower) priority
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
The transaction id

The priority to add or subtract.
The transaction selection algorithm considers the tx as it would have a higher priority.
(priority of a transaction is calculated: coinage * value_in_satoshis / txsize)

The fee value (in satoshis) to add (or subtract, if negative).
The fee is not actually paid, only the algorithm for selecting transactions into a block considers the transaction as it would have paid a higher (or lower) fee

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliMiningClient.PrioritiseTransactionAsync(System.String,System.Double,System.Double)

(priority of a transaction is calculated: coinage * value_in_satoshis / txsize)

The fee value (in satoshis) to add (or subtract, if negative).
he fee is not actually paid, only the algorithm for selecting transactions into a block considers the transaction as it would have paid a higher (or lower) fee

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliNetworkClient.PingAsync(System.String)

summary.para: Requests that a ping be sent to all other nodes, to measure ping time.
Results provided in getpeerinfo, pingtime and pingwait fields are decimal seconds.
Ping command is handled in queue with all other commands, so it measures processing backlog, not just network ping.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain

summary.para: Requests that a ping be sent to all other nodes, to measure ping time.
Results provided in getpeerinfo, pingtime and pingwait fields are decimal seconds.
Ping command is handled in queue with all other commands, so it measures processing backlog, not just network ping.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliRawClient.SignRawTransactionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Object[],System.Object[],System.String)

summary.para: Sign inputs for raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded).
The second optional argument (may be null) is an array of previous transaction outputs that this transaction depends on but may not yet be in the block chain.
The third optional argument (may be null) is an array of base58-encoded private keys that, if given, will be the only keys used to sign the transaction.
Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
The transaction hex string
An json array of previous dependent transaction outputs
A json array of base58-encoded private keys for signing
The signature hash type. Must be one of: "All", "NONE", "SINGLE", "ALL|ANYONECANPAY", "NONE|ANYONECANPAY", "SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY"

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliRawClient.SignRawTransactionAsync(System.String,System.Object[],System.Object[],System.String)

summary.para: Sign inputs for raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded).
The second optional argument (may be null) is an array of previous transaction outputs that this transaction depends on but may not yet be in the block chain.
The third optional argument (may be null) is an array of base58-encoded private keys that, if given, will be the only keys used to sign the transaction.
Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.param: The transaction hex string
An json array of previous dependent transaction outputs
A json array of base58-encoded private keys for signing
The signature hash type. Must be one of: "All", "NONE", "SINGLE", "ALL|ANYONECANPAY", "NONE|ANYONECANPAY", "SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY"

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliWalletClient.EncryptWalletAsync(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Encrypts the wallet with 'passphrase'. This is for first time encryption.

After this, any calls that interact with private keys such as sending or signing will require the passphrase to be set prior the making these calls. Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call. If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call. Note that this will shutdown the server.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliWalletClient.EncryptWalletAsync(System.String)

Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.param: The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long

member.param: Name of target blockchain
One of the following: stream txid, stream reference, stream name
Stream key

param.name: mode
param.para: Comma delimited list of the following: jsonobjectmerge (required) - merge json objects, recursive - merge json sub-objects recursively, noupdate - preserve first value for each key instead of taking the last, omitnull - omit keys with null values, ignoreother - ignore items that cannot be included in summary (otherwise returns an error), ignoremissing - ignore missing offchain items (otherwise returns an error), firstpublishersany - only summarize items by a publisher of first item with this key, firstpublishersall - only summarize items by all publishers of first item with this key

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliWalletClient.GetStreamKeySummaryAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns stream json object items summary for specific key.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.param: One of the following: stream txid, stream reference, stream name
Stream key

param.name: mode
param.para: Comma delimited list of the following: jsonobjectmerge (required) - merge json objects, recursive - merge json sub-objects recursively, noupdate - preserve first value for each key instead of taking the last, omitnull - omit keys with null values, ignoreother - ignore items that cannot be included in summary (otherwise returns an error), ignoremissing - ignore missing offchain items (otherwise returns an error), firstpublishersany - only summarize items by a publisher of first item with this key, firstpublishersall - only summarize items by all publishers of first item with this key

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliWalletClient.GrantAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
The multichain addresses to send to (comma delimited)

Permission strings, comma delimited.
Global: connect,send,receive,issue,mine,admin,activate,creat
or per-asset: asset-identifier.issue,admin,activate,send,receive
or per-stream: stream-identifier.write,activate,admin
Native currency amount to send. eg 0.1. Default - 0.0
Block to apply permissions from (inclusive). Default - 0
Block to apply permissions to (exclusive). Default - 4294967295; If -1 is specified default value is used.
A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.
A comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

The addresses, comma delimited or a json array of addresses
An optional label
(boolean or integer, optional, default=true) Rescan the wallet for transactions. If integer rescan from block, if negative - from the end

summary.para: Issue a new Asset to an address on the blockchain network.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
The address to send newly created asset to
(string, required) Asset name, if not "" should be unique or (object, required) A json object of with asset params
The asset total amount in display units. eg. 1234.56
Number of raw units in one displayed unit, eg 0.01 for cents. Default value is 1
native currency amount to send. eg 0.1, Default: minimum-per-output.
a json object with custom fields. { "param-name": "param-value" (strings, required) The key is the parameter name, the value is parameter value, ,... }

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliWalletClient.LockUnspentAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Updates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.
Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.
A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending assetss. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.
Also see the listunspent call
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.
member.param: Name of target blockchain
Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions
A json array of objects. Each object should have the the txid (string) vout (numeric)

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliWalletClient.LockUnspentAsync(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Updates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.

A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending assetss. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.
Also see the listunspent call
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.
member.param: Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions
A json array of objects. Each object should have the the txid (string) vout (numeric)

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliWalletClient.RevokeAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Revoke permission from a given address. The amount is a real. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.
member.param: Name of target blockchain
The addresses(es) to revoke permissions from

param.name: permissions
param.para: Permission strings, comma delimited. Global: connect,send,receive,issue,mine,admin,activate,create or per-asset: asset-identifier.issue,admin,activate,send,receive or per-stream: stream-identifier.write,activate,admin

member.param: native currency amount to send. eg 0.1. Default - 0
A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.
A comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

member.name: T:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliMining

MutliChain Core methods established by the IMultiChainCliMining contract
getblocktemplate, getmininginfo, getnetworkhashps, prioritisetransaction, submitblock

summary.para: Deprecated for the current version of Multichain; Do Not Use;
If the request parameters include a 'mode' key, that is used to explicitly select between the default 'template' request or a 'proposal'.
It returns data needed to construct a block to work on.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

param.name: json_request_object
param.para: (string, optional) A json object in the following spec
{ "mode":"template" (string, optional) This must be set to "template" or omitted
"capabilities":[ (array, optional) A list of strings
"support" (string) client side supported feature, 'longpoll', 'coinbasetxn', 'coinbasevalue', 'proposal', 'serverlist', 'workid'

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliMining.PrioritiseTransactionAsync(System.String,System.Double,System.Double)

summary.para: Accepts the transaction into mined blocks at a higher (or lower) priority
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.param: The transaction id

The priority to add or subtract.
The transaction selection algorithm considers the tx as it would have a higher priority.
(priority of a transaction is calculated: coinage * value_in_satoshis / txsize)

The fee value (in satoshis) to add (or subtract, if negative).
he fee is not actually paid, only the algorithm for selecting transactions into a block considers the transaction as it would have paid a higher (or lower) fee

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliMining.PrioritiseTransactionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double)

summary.para: Accepts the transaction into mined blocks at a higher (or lower) priority
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
The transaction id

The priority to add or subtract.
The transaction selection algorithm considers the tx as it would have a higher priority.
(priority of a transaction is calculated: coinage * value_in_satoshis / txsize)

The fee value (in satoshis) to add (or subtract, if negative).
The fee is not actually paid, only the algorithm for selecting transactions into a block considers the transaction as it would have paid a higher (or lower) fee

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliRaw.SignRawTransactionAsync(System.String,System.Object[],System.Object[],System.String)

summary.para: Sign inputs for raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded).
The second optional argument (may be null) is an array of previous transaction outputs that this transaction depends on but may not yet be in the block chain.
The third optional argument (may be null) is an array of base58-encoded private keys that, if given, will be the only keys used to sign the transaction.
Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.param: The transaction hex string
An json array of previous dependent transaction outputs
A json array of base58-encoded private keys for signing
The signature hash type. Must be one of: "All", "NONE", "SINGLE", "ALL|ANYONECANPAY", "NONE|ANYONECANPAY", "SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY"

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliRaw.SignRawTransactionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Object[],System.Object[],System.String)

The third optional argument (may be null) is an array of base58-encoded private keys that, if given, will be the only keys used to sign the transaction.
Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
The transaction hex string
An json array of previous dependent transaction outputs
A json array of base58-encoded private keys for signing
The signature hash type. Must be one of: "All", "NONE", "SINGLE", "ALL|ANYONECANPAY", "NONE|ANYONECANPAY", "SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY"

Each key is a address or hex-encoded public key.
If 'account' is specified, assign address to that account.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.
member.param: Name of target blockchain
The number of required signatures out of the n keys or addresses
A json array of addresses or hex-encoded public keys
An account to assign the addresses to. Accounts are not supported with the current version of MultiChain Core.

summary.para: Optimizes wallet performance by combining unspent txouts.
Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

The minimum confirmations to filter. Default - 1
Maximal number of transactions to send. Default - 100
Minimal number of txouts to combine in one transaction. Default - 2
Maximal number of txouts to combine in one transaction. Default - 100
Maximal time for creating combining transactions, at least one transaction will be sent. Default - 15s

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliWallet.EncryptWalletAsync(System.String)

summary.para: Encrypts the wallet with 'passphrase'. This is for first time encryption.

After this, any calls that interact with private keys such as sending or signing will require the passphrase to be set prior the making these calls. Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call. If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call. Note that this will shutdown the server.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.param: The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliWallet.EncryptWalletAsync(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Encrypts the wallet with 'passphrase'. This is for first time encryption.

After this, any calls that interact with private keys such as sending or signing will require the passphrase to be set prior the making these calls. Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call. If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call. Note that this will shutdown the server.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long

Also take locked outputs into account

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliWallet.GetStreamKeySummaryAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns stream json object items summary for specific key.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.param: One of the following: stream txid, stream reference, stream name
Stream key

param.name: mode
param.para: Comma delimited list of the following: jsonobjectmerge (required) - merge json objects, recursive - merge json sub-objects recursively, noupdate - preserve first value for each key instead of taking the last, omitnull - omit keys with null values, ignoreother - ignore items that cannot be included in summary (otherwise returns an error), ignoremissing - ignore missing offchain items (otherwise returns an error), firstpublishersany - only summarize items by a publisher of first item with this key, firstpublishersall - only summarize items by all publishers of first item with this key

param.name: mode
param.para: Comma delimited list of the following: jsonobjectmerge (required) - merge json objects, recursive - merge json sub-objects recursively, noupdate - preserve first value for each key instead of taking the last, omitnull - omit keys with null values, ignoreother - ignore items that cannot be included in summary (otherwise returns an error), ignoremissing - ignore missing offchain items (otherwise returns an error), firstpublishersany - only summarize items by a publisher of first item with this key, firstpublishersall - only summarize items by all publishers of first item with this key

summary.para: Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.

member.param: The multichain addresses to send to (comma delimited)

Permission strings, comma delimited.
Global: connect,send,receive,issue,mine,admin,activate,creat
or per-asset: asset-identifier.issue,admin,activate,send,receive
or per-stream: stream-identifier.write,activate,admin
Native currency amount to send. eg 0.1. Default - 0.0
Block to apply permissions from (inclusive). Default - 0
Block to apply permissions to (exclusive). Default - 4294967295; If -1 is specified default value is used.
A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.
A comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliWallet.LockUnspentAsync(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Updates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.
Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.
A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending assetss. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.
Also see the listunspent call
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.
member.param: Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions
A json array of objects. Each object should have the the txid (string) vout (numeric)

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliWallet.LockUnspentAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object[])

A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending assetss. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.
Also see the listunspent call
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.
member.param: Name of target blockchain
Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions
A json array of objects. Each object should have the the txid (string) vout (numeric)

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainCliWallet.RevokeAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Revoke permission from a given address. The amount is a real. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is inferred from CliOptions properties.
member.param: The addresses(es) to revoke permissions from

param.name: permissions
param.para: Permission strings, comma delimited. Global: connect,send,receive,issue,mine,admin,activate,create or per-asset: asset-identifier.issue,admin,activate,send,receive or per-stream: stream-identifier.write,activate,admin

member.param: native currency amount to send. eg 0.1. Default - 0
A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.
A comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

member.name: M:MCWrapper.CLI.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainCliForgeClient.CreateColdNodeAsync(System.String)
member.summary:
Create a local MultiChain blockchain cold node/wallet Create a Cold Node
If Hot Wallet path does not exist throw exception since we won't be able to access the Hot Wallet's params.dat file which is required to configure the Cold Wallet properly.
Next, verify whether or not the MultiChainCold directory exists in the /AppData/Roaming folder. If the Cold Node directory does not exist, we create it. If we end up creating this folder then we store the returned DirectoryInfo as coldNodeDirectory since we will need to create the Code Wallet sub-directory within the new Cold Node folder.
Next, verify whether or not a folder named after the passed blockchainName value exists in the Cold Wallet path. If the Cold Wallet path does not exist, we create it.
Finally, we check if a params.dat file is available in the Cold Wallet path. If not, then we copy it from the Hot Node path.
